text: Amazing fresh meats, local products and ingredients. We stop by here for dinner every year on our way down after skiing at Tremblant. The food and service is always top notch. My only request is to have English Menus, please! The waiter has to translate from French every time

The only reason I'm rating this restaurant and butcher shop 4 instead of 5 is because they only have French menus. Not sure if that changes during "tourist" season. My meal was excellent - from a perfectly mixed negroni to inventive in-house and local charcuterie to a light lobster linguine to an over the top Pouding Chomeur for dessert. Everything was local, felt very authentic...would be a shame for non-French speaking diners to miss out simply because of a language gap. Also, great wine list, very friendly sommelier, staff and they, unprompted, offered to make burgers/grilled cheese or pasta for the kids.

Beau restaurant, belle terrasse! Un décor de toute beauté avec un menu qui semble alléchant. Mais le service incroyablement lent lorsque le restaurant est presque vide. Notre serveuse (française, cheveux brun, tattoos) non sympathique et très je-m'enfoutisme a fait de cette expérience un 1 étoile sur 5. Je me devais de venir écrire un avis tellement elle fut arrogante/antipathique.
1H à attendre un tartare au saumon (entrée) qui n'était malheureusement pas mieux qu'ordinaire. Très dommage. Après une heure d'attente, aucun remplissage de la bouteille d'eau, nous avons laisser faire de commander un dessert ou un verre.. Le plus vite parti, le mieux c'était.
Super place ! À connaître ! Je vous le recommande.  Super Grill Cheese au boudin.  Personnel courtois.

10/10 !!!! Incroyable comme restaurant ! Sérieusement, vous devez essayer la cote de boeuf de 1 kilo à partager !!! C'est la spécialité de l'endroit et c'est divin !!! (Seulement 90 pour deux ) 

De plus, les plateaux de charcuterie sont excellent ! Il font plusieurs produit sur place comme des saucissons et des terrine ! 

Nous sommes très heureux d'avoir découvert ce restaurant !

Very nice place in St-Adèle!  First snow of the year!  We had a great evening a great dinner.  You can't go there without having ribs.  Parking is a bit challenging (ended-up on the street), but it's worth the detour.

If you like what you ate, stop by their butchery section and bring back some meat!

Great place to stop on your way back from skiing in the Laurentians. It's a restaurant that doubles as a high end butcher counter, so the meat they use in their dishes is of excellent quality. They also have a nice selection of local beers.

Très beau resto. Trendy, jeune. 
Salade César et boudin delish!!!  
Comptoir avec produits recherchés pour emporter. 

Manque plus que des chocolats Catherine et chocolat!

Ate here with friends at the start to a long weekend in the Laurentians to see the fall colours.  Yes, it's partly a butcher shop and partly a restaurant, so the decor is not exactly sophisticated, plus it's on the side of the 117, but it is well worth a stop on your way up north.

I had a green salad that was a fresh and tasty mesclun with a simple dressing, to start. Others in our party had Mac and cheese and charcuterie, which they appreciated. My beloved had the beef tartare and I had the onglet. The meat was really delicious and tender. I found the tartare nicely spiced (though my beloved found it a little over-spiced). The onglet was melt-in-your-mouth tender, cooked rare (European-style rare) and served with a delicious reduction sauce and fries. The fries were very good also.

For dessert, we tried the crème brûlée and the fondant au Chocolat. I have never tasted one quite so light. It was almost a soufflé and not too sweet. The. Crème brûlée was the perfect temperature with a sheet of caramel on top, just as it should be.

We washed it all down with a half litre bottle of Crianza, which was a perfect red meat accompaniment. Choices of wine in half bottles and by the glass were sufficient, which is handy when you're getting behind the wheel again. 

Portions were also European-style however, so it was quite expensive by comparison to other restaurants. But it was nice to leave the table without feeling too stuffed, and I'd go back again simply because I haven't had such tasty meat in a long, long time. 

A note on service, just because I see others were dissatisfied. It was unexceptional but nothing to complain about. If meat is your thing, you won't regret trying Les Têtes de Cochon.

My husband and I dined here for our 15th year anniversary as a couple. Everything was perfect! 
The service was very pleasant, both waiters were helpful and agreeable. The food was excellent; my husband had the rib platter, and I, the beef and salmon tartar, and we both shared scallops and oysters as starters.
 And as it was Thursday, we had the chance of enjoying live music with Mr Evans who had an excellent range of music which were sung  perfectly.

Very nice selection of dishes on the menu. The bbq ribs were tender and smoky, and the grilled scallops with crab risotto was nicely executed with its subtle flavors. I preferred the red sangria over the white sangria but overall I had a wonderful meal. Service was on point and courteous. A great choice if you are in the area.
True gem. Delicious food, professional yet friendly service and private wine selection. Love the little market secretion. A must in the area, definitely worth a stop.

Très belle place pour petit souper intime 
Les produits sont frais et de bonne qualité

Terrific organically sourced menu.  We had the daily specials of lamb and beef bavette (flank/skirt) steak which were excellent along with fresh grilled vegetables.  We also had excellent desserts and cappuccinos in a contemporary rustic setting in the heart of the Laurentians. Attentive and friendly service.
Délicieux, authentique et délicat à la fois. La Poutine Super Cochon est définitivement à goûter. Service très accueillant et ambiance très sympa!
Toute une découverte à Ste-Adèle. Ambiance géniale. Excellent service. Repas originaux, bien présentés et succulents. Restaurant qui vaut certainement le détour.

je suis toujours étonnée de découvrir les restaurants des régions et de réaliser à quel point ils offrent une expérience hors du commun ! 

Ce restaurant est parfait tout simplement! De la bouffe au service, jusqu'au design du restau, vraiment c'est merveilleux ! Nous nous somme gâtés et nous nous sommes laissés tentés par leur kilo de boeuf vieillit pendant 45 jours et cuit pendant 45 minutes comme repas principal à partager, mais nous avons aussi pris une planche de charcuteries en entrée... je suis sans mot ! Tout était préparé, coupé, servi à la perfection ! Ce fut un vrai souper de délices! 

Je vous le recommande, c'est tout simplement un must dans le coin de Ste-Adèle !

The duck confit was worth waiting for...but the service was less than attentive. We arrived at 6pm and did not finish until 9:30pm. Waited a longtime for water then drinks and our meal... The wait staff mentioned a new chef in the kitchen. Good concept, needs better execution.

Honestly, this place was ok. On a scale from "burn it with fire!" to "Woo-Hoo!l, it scored a "yumm!".

The person who sat us was creepy and spoke such accented French that I had trouble understanding him.

Our waitress was great. She was attentive and knowledgable, but she just wasn't around enough. It felt like an French bistro, where you have to signal your server for attention. Not what I expected in Ste-Adèle. 

The food was good. Local, organic, this- and that- free. My partner had a pouting with chèvre and merguez, and I had the steak frites du jour. The pouting was good, and the steak was perfectly cooked to my requested medium. However, I found that there was too much "going on" on my plate, between the steak, frites, veggies, beet purée AND gravy. The flavours all kind of melded and nothing shone. Which is a shame because the steak really should have been the star of that plate.

The desert is what made it a "yum" and not a "meh". We each had the crème brûlée with the side shooter. It was delicious. Exactly the way a crème brûlée should be. It came with fruit, which was promptly ignored.

As soon as this place learns to ignore the fancy bullshit and focus on the flavours, it'll be awesome.

If we're ever in Ste-Adèle, we might go back, but it's not worth a drive from Montréal or Tremblant.

On profitait d'un séjour dans les Laurentides ma copine et moi et nous nous sommes arrêtés pour manger dans ce restaurant. On avait pas si faim que ça, donc, on voulait juste quelque chose de simple, pas complexe, rien d'élaborer. On a donc pris une simple salade césar croustillante (13$) + poutine super cochon (22$), pour boire une bière IPA (7,50$) & un verre de vin (12,75$) pour un total avec taxes/pourboire/service 71,77$ !!! Assez cher merci pour ce que c'est vraiment, on est dans les Laurentides, pas à Montréal ! Ça vaut pas ça ! La salade était bonne mais petite et la poutine était même pas bonne, le fromage en cubes pas fondu, une petite tranche de smoked-meat, rien d'extraordinaire. Service bâclé du serveur. Je déteste ce style de restaurant, il y avait pourtant beaucoup de monde, ça semble populaire dans le coin, ambiance jeune et stylé. Bref, assez déçu dans l'ensemble, la qualité de la bouffe n'y était pas et le service aussi ! 

2/5 visité en février 2017
